document.docAuthor: Ferrer-Suay, Mar, Selfa, Jesús & Pujade-Villar, Juli
document.masterDocTitle: Palaearctic species of Charipinae (Hymenoptera, Figitidae): two new species, synthesis and identification key

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Palaearctic species of Charipinae (Hymenoptera, Figitidae): two new species, synthesis and identification key

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Allotria brevis Thomson, 1862: 408
. Type : deposited in MZLU (examined).

Allotria ( Allotria ) brevis
–
Dalla Torre & Kieffer 1902: 40
.

Charips ( Charips ) brevis
–
Dalla Torre & Kieffer 1910: 276
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Alloxysta brevis
is mainly characterized by a small closed radial cell that is 2.1 times as long as wide (Fig. 4.7); the absence of pronotal carina (Fig. 8.2); the presence of propodeal carinae that form a plate; and female and male antenna with rhinaria beginning on F4, F1 shorter than pedicel, and F1–F3 subequal in length (Fig. 2.9). It is similar to
A. darci
, but can be differentiated by the length of antenna (shorter than the body in
A. brevis
, but longer in
A. darci
) and the marginal setae of the fore wing (shorter in
A. brevis
than
A. darci
).

materialsCitation.collectorName: Ld & Lund & Lectotype & Ferrer-Suay & M. Ferrer-Suay

New records: Czech Republic , Greece , Moravia, Morocco , Russia , Spain , Switzerland .
